sentences.english: A hot wave of anger swept over the American public.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的怒潮席卷美国公众。

sentences.english: But a rising wave of anger is directed against the new " malefactors of great wealth".
sentences.chinese: 但是新一轮的怒潮正冲向“富有的恶人们”。

sentences.english: The raging tide of China's revolution is forcing all social strata to decide their attitude.
sentences.chinese: 中国革命的怒潮正在迫使各社会阶层决定自己的态度。

sentences.english: At the other end of the Pacific, Yi is breathing the air of the approaching storm.
sentences.chinese: 阿联隔着太平洋，呼吸到了风暴即将来临的怒潮。

sentences.english: But a rising wave of anger is directed against the new "malefactors of great wealth".
sentences.chinese: 然而新的一轮怒潮正扑向新一代的为富不仁者。

sentences.english: The raging tide of revolution surges forward .
The raging tide of revolution surges forward.

definition: lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to beat against the shore (of waves)
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
